body:
Thanks for posting in our issue tracker.
In order to properly assist you, we need additional information:

- When does the issue occur?
- What do you see?
- What was the expected result?
- Can you supply us with a stacktrace? (optional)
- Do you have exact code to reproduce it? Maybe a PHPUnit tests that fails? (optional)

Thanks!

_This is an automated comment, triggered by adding the label `status:need more info`._

@samdark Yes I mean multiple grids, and thus multiple data providers; the code snippet is a source comment from  the `baseDataProvider` class.
I'd propose to implement a simple static counter that sets an id for all but the first active data provider, in the same manner it is done for widgets; this will:
- Not change anything if you have 1 provider
- Not change anything if you have 1 or more providers but they have ids.
- Add ids if you have multiple providers but have not set ids.
Yes. That could be a good idea.

If we choose the first `$id` to be `""` the I think we're fine; of course of people depend on the broken behavior then all bets are off...

Also this will not work if the order of grids is not consistent; consider a page with 5 grids that are randomly ordered then autoincrement will work unreliably but not setting ids (and thus having shared ids) will work by paging all gridviews at the same time...
People may rely on GET parameter names.
Yes that is why I suggest the first id to be `""`, so their parameter names won't change.
Can you confirm this is something you'd merge?
Yes. That's clearly a bug. I can't imagine a case when this is desired behavior so I'm all for fixing it.

issue.title: WIP: Fix issue 13376
